entry.title: Custom logic for payment advice to add profit center
entry.content:
We are using custom logic for the profit center population in the payment advice form (business context: FINS_PAYMENT_ADVICE_ITEM, ID: FBL_PAYM_ADV_PRINT_ITEM ). The issue is Profit center of the 1st line is repeated for the all the line in the payment advice.

 

DATA: lv_comp        TYPE c LENGTH 4,
      lv_jou         TYPE c LENGTH 10,
      lv_year        TYPE c LENGTH 4,
      lv_pft_ctr     TYPE i_journalentryitem-profitcenter,
      lv_pft_desc    TYPE i_profitcentertext-profitcentername,
      lc_lang        TYPE c LENGTH 1 VALUE 'E',
      wa_item     LIKE LINE OF paymentpaiditems.

 

LOOP AT paymentpaiditems INTO wa_item.

 

  CLEAR: lv_comp, lv_jou, lv_year, lv_pft_ctr, lv_pft_desc.

 

  lv_comp = wa_item-doc2r+0(4).
  lv_jou  = wa_item-doc2r+4(10).
  lv_year = wa_item-doc2r+14(4).

 

  SELECT SINGLE profitcenter
    INTO @LV_pft_ctr
    FROM i_journalentryitem
    WHERE companycode        = @LV_comp
      AND accountingdocument = @LV_jou
      AND fiscalyear         = @LV_year.

 

  IF lv_pft_ctr IS NOT INITIAL.
    SELECT SINGLE profitcentername
      INTO @LV_pft_desc
      FROM i_profitcentertext
      WHERE profitcenter = @LV_pft_ctr
        AND language     = @LC_lang.
  ENDIF.

 

  payment_advice_item_ext-yy1_pftctrpaymentadvic_avi = lv_pft_desc.

 

ENDLOOP.

entry.title: How does the Year-End Adjustment of Pro Rata VAT deal with closed WBS?
entry.content: Is the pro rata year-end adjustment also calculated for a WBS that was closed during the year? And in what way is the correction then booked knowing that no posting is allowed on the closed WBS?

entry.title: Emergency: Affecting 100 people,Acct cant enter into the SAP &Cant select the BR Acct table as key
entry.content: The Brazilian National Public Cloud System has activated the local Brazilian chart of accounts. As a Brazilian group company, the Chinese entity must map its group-level accounts to the system to align with the local Brazilian accounts (maintaining two sets of accounts: one for the group and one for Brazil). 1. When configuring the chart of accounts, the Brazilian company's operational accounts are automatically assigned the YCOA standard. The YCBR Brazilian chart of accounts serves as an alternative chart of accounts (the system should designate which accounts belong under the group-level chart and which under the local Brazilian chart).

entry.title: Change the remitter name (payer name / 振込元の依頼人名) only for a specific supplier
entry.content:
We have a requirement to change the remitter name (payer name / 振込元の依頼人名) only for a specific supplier in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

As far as we understand:

The remitter name is configured only at Company Code × Payment Method level via SSCUI 101044 – Set Up Payment Methods per Company Code.

We cannot find any SSCUI, Cloud BAdI, or Custom Logic that allows overriding the remitter name at vendor level.

Payment Medium Cloud BAdIs seem to allow only adding reference fields or changing file names, but not modifying the remitter/payer name in the payment file.

My questions:

1. Is there any supported way in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to override the remitter name for a specific supplier (vendor-specific)?

2. If not, is creating a dedicated payment method (with a different remitter name) and assigning it only to that supplier considered the recommended workaround?

3. Has anyone implemented a similar requirement, or is this fully restricted due to Public Cloud limitations?

Any insights, confirmation, or SAP official references would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: F110 : payment not possible because of reported error
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We have created a new company code in SAP, and the configuration appears to be complete. Nothing seems to be missing in the FBZP setup.

However, I am unable to process any payments using F110. The system returns the message “Payment not possible because of reported error” without indicating which error it refers to.

At first, I suspected that the issue might be related to errors not appearing in the log. But after running tests that intentionally blocked the payment, the corresponding errors did appear in the log.
This makes it unclear why, when everything seems correctly configured, the payment still fails while showing an error without any details.

 

Can anyone help ?

entry.title: Definição de conta para Impostos a recuperar
entry.content:
Boa Tarde!

Estou com um caso em que na contabilização, o PIS, com crédito, a recuperar, vai para a conta de estoque corretamente.

Já o Cofins, com crédito, a recuperar, vai para a conta de Variação de Preço.

Pis = Creditando PIS e debitando Conta de Estoque.

Cofins = Creditando Cofins e debitando Conta de Variação de Preço.

Grato desde já!

entry.title: Operating Concern and Controlling Area
entry.content:
Please let me know whether my understanding is correct. If not, I would appreciate guidance on any points I may have misinterpreted.

  1. One operating concern can contain multiple controlling areas.
  2. Operating Concern is the highest organizational unit in profitability analysis. (COPA) 
  3. Controlling Area is the highest organizational unit in Controlling (CO) 
  4. Controlling Area controls internal accounting, cost center accounting, internal orders, product costing, COPA settlement relations.
  5. Operating Concern defines how you want to analyze profitability (market-driven view).
  6. Operating Concern stores revenue, cost of sales, margins, contribution, characteristics, and value fields.
  7. Operating Concern can be mapped to multiple company codes condition all company codes must share same characteristics and values.
  8. Controlling Area can be mapped to multiple company codes condition all company codes must share same FYV and Chart of Account.
  9. Also can we say controlling area is for internal costing and operating concern is for profiability based on marketing and sales against external compnents like products, customers or zones ?

entry.title: SAP ISU FICA clearing document posting
entry.content:
Hi Experts 

I got one requirement from client, 

T code - FP06 & FPMA 

while clearing the document sometime 2 credit and 2 debit item is there client want to see only one clearing document with each payment item, example payment 1 and clearing document should post only one for each payment  line item. 

Current behaviour: while clearing manually or automatically from background job single clearing document is posted for all the open item clearing. 

Requirement: Manual and automatic clearing should generate a single clearing document for each payment document 0060/0010 Cr and 0010/0020 Dr If User want to filter the clearing document it should be unique for payment document. 

Please assist me to get any event. 

Thanks

Yusuf

entry.title: inventory list as of a specific date
entry.content:
Hi ,

The auditors are asking me an inventory list as of Nov 30. someone told me to use trx code MRN9. But even if I put 2025-11-30 as a key date, the values are live (2025-12-12). Do you know if there is another way to extract the inventory list at a specific date?

entry.title: FBL1N or FBL5N, the Profit Center field is always blank.
entry.content:
When I open FBL1N or FBL5N, the Profit Center field is always blank.

I understand that this happens because these reports are based on BSEG, which is the entry view. In the entry view, the Profit Center is not stored on the vendor line item.

When I switch to the G/L view, the Profit Center appears correctly with values.

Also, Document Splitting is active and working fine, and the Profit Center is correctly derived on the G/L lines.

entry.title: S_ALR_87012284 Plan version Hard currency comparison period issue
entry.content:
Post stack upgrade of S/4 Hana 2023, we noticed that there is a new field of plan version to be selected to execute the report. If we do not enter the plan version (0), hard currency (40) values do not display for reporting as well as comparison period.

 

If we enter Plan version as 0, hard currency values display for reporting period but not for the comparison period. Can anyone share valuable insights

 

#SAPS/4HANA #FIN (Finance) #Accounting and Financial Close @sapcommunity1

entry.title: How can finance and accounting students better understand SAP FICO concepts in practice?
entry.content: I've noticed that many finance and accounting students understand theoretical concepts such as general ledger accounting, cost centres, and financial reporting, but struggle when these same topics are introduced in SAP FICO. What learning methods or practical approaches do SAP professionals recommend to help students bridge the gap between academic accounting theory and SAP-based financial processes? Are there specific exercises, examples, or documentation that work well for beginners who are learning SAP FICO alongside their studies

entry.title: PR still showing as commitment after PO creation in commitment report
entry.content:
In the commitment report, both the Purchase Requisition (PR) and the Purchase Order (PO) are appearing as active commitments for the same WBS requirement. Once the PO is created referencing the PR, the PR should either be reduced to zero or no longer show as a commitment.
Requesting guidance to correct the behavior and update commitments so only the PO is reflected. Please advise on configuration and data correction steps.
